content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-076-13-A |Item_parent=Alcohol dependence |Item_parent_short=Alcohol dependence |Rank=A |Title=Knowing the basic principles of primary prevention of alcohol misuse |Description=None |Rubric=Definition |Contributors= |Order=13}} Objective: to prevent or delay the first use of psychoactive substances, in particular by acting on early use. - Takes into account the person rather than the substance - Frees itself from any judgmental or stigmatising attitude. The main tools are information and education for future users, to reduce risk factors and promote healthy behaviour.

question.title: What is the main focus of primary prevention of alcohol misuse?
question.description: What is the main focus of primary prevention of alcohol misuse?

option_a.title: Substance rather than person
option_a.description: Focusing on the substance rather than the person using it

option_b.title: Judgmental approach
option_b.description: Taking a judgmental or stigmatising attitude towards individuals

option_c.title: Early intervention
option_c.description: Acting on early use to prevent or delay the first use of psychoactive substances

option_d.title: Education for existing users
option_d.description: Providing information and education to individuals who are already using psychoactive substances
